briefdescription.para: asynUser for connecting to NDArray driver
Handle for connecting to NDArray driver.
asyn interface for connecting to NDArray driver

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, int queueSize, int blockingCallbacks, const char *NDArrayPort, int NDArrayAddr, int maxAddr, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int interfaceMask, int interruptMask, int asynFlags, int autoConnect, int priority, int stackSize, int maxThreads, bool compressionAware=false)
memberdef.name: NDPluginDriver

briefdescription.para: Constructor for NDPluginDriver; most parameters are simply passed to asynNDArrayDriver::asynNDArrayDriver.

detaileddescription.para:
After calling the base class constructor this method creates a thread to execute the NDArray callbacks, and sets reasonable default values for all of the parameters defined in NDPluginDriver.h.
portName
The name of the asyn port driver to be created.
queueSize
The number of NDArrays that the input queue for this plugin can hold when NDPluginDriverBlockingCallbacks=0. Larger queues can decrease the number of dropped arrays, at the expense of more NDArray buffers being allocated from the underlying driver's NDArrayPool.
blockingCallbacks
Initial setting for the NDPluginDriverBlockingCallbacks flag. 0=callbacks are queued and executed by the callback thread; 1 callbacks execute in the thread of the driver doing the callbacks.
NDArrayPort
Name of asyn port driver for initial source of NDArray callbacks.
NDArrayAddr
asyn port driver address for initial source of NDArray callbacks.
maxAddr
The maximum number of asyn addr addresses this driver supports. 1 is minimum.
maxBuffers
The maximum number of NDArray buffers that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to 0 to allow an unlimited number of buffers.
maxMemory
The maximum amount of memory that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to 0 to allow an unlimited amount of memory.
interfaceMask
Bit mask defining the asyn interfaces that this driver supports.
interruptMask
Bit mask definining the asyn interfaces that can generate interrupts (callbacks)
asynFlags
Flags when creating the asyn port driver; includes ASYN_CANBLOCK and ASYN_MULTIDEVICE.
autoConnect
The autoConnect flag for the asyn port driver.
priority
The thread priority for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags. This value should also be used for any other threads this object creates.
stackSize
The stack size for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags. This value should also be used for any other threads this object creates.
maxThreads
The maximum number of threads this plugin is allowed to use.
compressionAware
true if the plugin can handle compressed input arrays, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynInt32->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including NDPluginDriverEnableCallbacks and NDPluginDriverArrayAddr. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynFloat64->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for NDPluginDriverMaxByteRate. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynOctet->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including NDPluginDriverArrayPort. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Address of the string to write.
nChars
Number of characters to write.
nActual
Number of characters actually written.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynInt32Array->read().

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the value of the array dimensions for the last NDArray.
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Pointer to the array to read.
nElements
Number of elements to read.
nIn
Number of elements actually read.

briefdescription.para: Method that is called from the driver with a new NDArray.

detaileddescription.para:
It calls the processCallbacks function, which typically is implemented in the derived class. It can either do the callbacks directly (if NDPluginDriverBlockingCallbacks=1) or by queueing the arrays to be processed by a background task (if NDPluginDriverBlockingCallbacks=0). In the latter case arrays can be dropped if the queue is full. This method should really be private, but it must be called from a C-linkage callback function, so it must be public.
pasynUser
The pasynUser from the asyn client.
genericPointer
The pointer to the NDArray

briefdescription.para: Starts the thread that receives NDArrays from the epicsMessageQueue.
Starts the plugin threads.

detaileddescription.para: This method must be called after the derived class object is fully constructed.

briefdescription.para: Method runs as a separate thread, periodically doing NDArray callbacks to downstream plugins.

detaileddescription.para: This thread is used when SortMode=1. This method should really be private, but it must be called from a C-linkage callback function, so it must be public.

briefdescription.para: Method that is normally called at the beginning of the processCallbacks method in derived classes.

detaileddescription.para:
pArray
The NDArray from the callback.
This method takes care of some bookkeeping for callbacks, updating parameters from data in the class and in the NDArray. It does asynInt32Array callbacks for the dimensions array if the dimensions of the NDArray data have changed.

briefdescription.para: Method that is normally called at the end of the processCallbacks()) method in derived classes.

detaileddescription.para:
pArray
The NDArray from the callback.
copyArray
This flag should be true if pArray is the original array passed to processCallbacks(). It must be false if the derived class if pArray is a new NDArray that processCallbacks() created
readAttributes
This flag must be true if the derived class has not yet called readAttributes() for pArray.
This method does NDArray callbacks to downstream plugins if NDArrayCallbacks is true and SortMode is Unsorted. If SortMode is sorted it inserts the NDArray into the std::multilist for callbacks in SortThread(). It keeps track of DisorderedArrays and DroppedOutputArrays. It caches the most recent NDArray in pArrays[0].

briefdescription.para: Connect this plugin to an NDArray port driver; disconnect from any existing driver first, register for callbacks if enabled.
Register or unregister to receive asynGenericPointer (NDArray) callbacks from the driver.

detaileddescription.para:
Note: this function must be called with the lock released, otherwise a deadlock can occur in the call to cancelInterruptUser.
enableCallbacks
1 to enable callbacks, 0 to disable callbacks

briefdescription.para: Method runs as a separate thread, waiting for NDArrays to arrive in a message queue and processing them.

detaileddescription.para: This thread is used when NDPluginDriverBlockingCallbacks=0. This method should really be private, but it must be called from a C-linkage callback function, so it must be public.

briefdescription.para: Creates the plugin threads.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when BlockingCallbacks is 0, and whenever QueueSize or NumThreads is changed.

briefdescription.para: Starts the plugin threads.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called from NDPluginDriver::start and whenever the number of threads is changed.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the plugin threads.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called from the destructor and whenever QueueSize or NumThreads is changed.

briefdescription.para: Creates the sorting thread.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when SortMode is set to Sorted.

briefdescription.para: Class from which actual plugin drivers are derived; derived from asynNDArrayDriver.
